text: [ <extra_id_0> Glucocorticoid receptors <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in peripheral blood lymphocytes of patients with bronchial asthma ]

Quantitation of <extra_id_0> glucocorticoid receptors <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> GCR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) and the study of their affinity for glucocorticosteroids ( GCS ) were made in peripheral blood lymphocytes of bronchial asthma ( BA ) patients in consideration of <extra_id_0> GCR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> treatment and serum levels of endogenous cortisol .
It is stated that <extra_id_0> GCR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> of healthy controls and GCS-untreated patients outnumbered those of cortisol - dependent BA patients on hormone therapy .
Following discontinuation of glucocorticoid drugs <extra_id_0> GCR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> count in cortisol - dependent BA tends to rise .
Endogenous cortisol has no effect on <extra_id_0> GCR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> level estimated by 3H-triamcinolone acetonide .
